name: Alaska Migratory Bird Co-Management Council
objective: To facilitate and administer regional programs to involve subsistence hunters of migratory birds in the management and regulation of migratory birds.
applicant_types: Local (includes State-designated Indian Tribes, excludes institutions of higher education and hospitals
Native American Organizations (includes Indian groups, cooperatives, corporations, partnerships, associations)
Public nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)
State (includes District of Columbia, public institutions of higher education and hospitals)

results.description: All 12 financial assistance awards will continue as part of the 5 year plans.  Program emphasis will continue to focus of evaluating the harvest surveys and regulatory program to fulfill co-management objectives. One application was received for one Cooperative Agreement renewal.
10 grant applications were received for 10 grant renewals.
All financial assistance awards will continue, if funded, as a part of 5 year plans ending 2022.
All financial assistance awards will continue, if funded, as a part of 5-year plans ending 2022.

authorizations.text: Fish and Wildlife Coordination Act, 16 U.S.C. §§661-666; Migratory Bird Treaty Act, 16 U.S.C. §703 et seq.; and Migratory Bird Subsistence Harvest in Alaska 50 C.F.R. 92.10-12.
